document.title: Connecticut Elementary and Secondary Social Studies Standards

1E75967F18CC437281A97421F8475078.description:
Explain how a trade barrier has shaped global or regional trade in historical and
contemporary contexts (e.g., tariff barrier, non-tariff barrier, embargo).

0EECD80741E34953B224871C8E6EDC87.description:
Explain how improvements in productivity enhance the standard of living in a region (e.g.,
automation, computer processing, 4-day workweek).

49F7A379EA0849EFA71F8F633C43E9E6.description:
Describe tools and resources that are used to measure standard of living (e.g., Gross
Domestic Product, Human Development Index).

468DDB40C66143EBB45818E75AA20610.description:
Explain how economic fluctuations and cycles affect individuals and groups in a region
(e.g., deflation, inflation, unemployment, depression, recession).

A5843670978D4F14B9619B52E9CEEE67.description:
Describe the role of labor unions, corporations, and non-profits within the market economy
of a region (e.g., representation, collective bargaining, production, investment, social
impact, advocacy).

CE22B95393D549B79C1FCBC2E2BECCC3.description: Analyze the role of innovation and entrepreneurship in a market economy (e.g., mills, transportation, electricity, computer technology, research and development, knowledge economy).

56B1B3B4846C466DAB791C42306C3285.description:
Explain how changes in supply and demand have influenced the price and quantity of a
good or service in a region (e.g., gold inflation related to Mansa Musa’s Hajj, Dutch fur trade
in North America, Rainforest logging, Cobalt mining in Democratic Republic of the Congo,
global agriculture, Venezuela oil production, illegal poaching).

E79A5E36DD954ADEA4043888EE2BA70E.description:
Explain ways in which money facilitates the exchange of goods and services in both
historical and contemporary contexts (e.g., cattle, Cowrie shells, wampum, coins,
banknotes, credit cards, cryptocurrency).

00707203B8D94498A01C874C120F46DD.description:
Describe the role of competition in a market economy (e.g., prices, wages, tariffs, trade
agreements, international trade organizations).

A448746E2D01406EA7AF17817B8DC41C.description: Describe different types of economies (e.g., command, market, mixed).

CA0F5FC44F5D44B7AE385FE8DE2E3E69.description:
Explain how norms regarding gender and sexuality influence the daily lives of people
(e.g., LGBTQ+ rights, family structures, matrilineal societies, division of labor, political
participation).

BE06AAB5A6164A3B9247034B3D8753B7.description:
Describe a series of political events and developments that reflect change and continuity
throughout the history of a region (e.g., trans-Saharan Migration, Spanish Conquest
of Hispaniola, Mexican Revolution, Cuban Revolution, Latin American independence,
Apartheid, Central African Republic Civil War, Yogyakarta Principles, Timbuktu).

A1E45B21BD6D4BAC99FB8941720C5277.description:
Analyze the purpose, implementation, and consequences of a policy in both historical and
contemporary contexts (e.g., environmental, human rights, public health, White Australia
Policy).

54AD6AEBD9D44A4E9102BE85D3E64C03.description:
Describe the roles of political and economic organizations in shaping lives of individuals
and groups in a region (e.g., World Bank, United Nations, International Monetary
Fund, International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, World Trade
Organization).

AD6EACEE5E304BB5A9D35BB7A3C034F8.description:
Classify the kinds of historical sources used in a secondary interpretations of a globally
or regionally significant event or issue (e.g., genocide, natural disasters, climate change,
refugee crises, human trafficking).

4EAB4ED2F20845EC87BFA061A00CE7AF.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of rules, laws, and agreements as a means of addressing
regional and global problems (e.g., International Court of Justice, International Criminal
Court, Paris Agreement, International Atomic Energy Agency).

073EC9C8EBF5425CABAE20CAB761D8A8.description:
Explain how political participation varies within different types of government in different
eras and contexts (e.g., compulsory voting, protest, volunteerism, women’s suffrage).

C3D97FC003804BC1BC26BABD07FB5438.description:
Identify the powers and responsibilities of individuals, groups, and media in addressing
human rights issues in both governmental and nongovernmental contexts (e.g., Universal
Declaration of Human Rights, International Refugee Assistance, United States Border
Security, United Nations).

DF288741BD1A4641BA1EE03CF74CDCF0.description:
Analyze how maps represent the perspectives of individuals and groups during different eras
(e.g., Treaty of Tordesillas map, Catalan Atlas, Mercator Projection, Carte du Congo Belge).

7B4AD2788AFB4035A9A0E50C85C0A231.description:
Explain how global changes in population distribution patterns have affected land use in a
region (e.g., the Pampas, Deforestation in the Amazon, Southwest United States population
boom).

A3D37A59045E44A5885F93293BF604C4.description:
Analyze how environmental characteristics vary among regions (e.g., climate, natural
disasters, waterways, mountain ranges, deserts).

B0848468323C4F23A0FF9DD33BDAB742.description:
Analyze how cultural characteristics vary among regions and shape diversity of local
communities (e.g., cultural centers, diasporas, cultural universals, taboos, linguistics).

04406EBE638D453C88E267FE11A76840.description:
Evaluate the influences of long-term human-induced environmental change on spatial
patterns of conflict and cooperation within a region (e.g., State Barrier Fence of Western
Australia, uncontacted Indigenous tribes, Third Agricultural Revolution).

318BF5AB00834763BBD35F35A0822828.description:
Analyze how human-environment interactions influence movement and settlement (e.g.,
Floating City Of Ganvie, The Dry Corridor, Tenochtitlán, Silk Road, trans-Saharan caravans).

EF19F2E179544C92BEBA7F0E94D0B999.description:
Describe how growth in communication technology has led to the diffusion of ideas and
cultural practices (e.g., Hollywood, global news networks, television, telecommunication
infrastructure, social media).

D1A55E30E5974767A5FF86C3AC5CA51D.description:
Explain how changes in transportation have led to regional and global connections among
human settlements (e.g., United States Interstate Highway System, Panama Canal, Mombasa–
Nairobi Standard Gauge Railway).

856BCCFBBDC44F17A7F33F447BA01862.description:
Analyze cultural diffusion among regions using paper based and digital mapping techniques
(e.g., expansion, relocation).

2AC12803CD0B4F0C916C0794426C5A5D.description:
Assess individual and collective capacities to take action to address local, regional, and
global problems, taking into account a range of possible levers of power, strategies, and
potential outcomes.

268632BA41A3499E908274C0D3D5AAFA.description:
Analyze how a specific problem can manifest itself at local, regional, and global levels
over time, identifying its characteristics and causes, and the challenges and opportunities
faced by those trying to address the problem.

C4A0B087BE7648D9BA6C8DDECA18392A.description:
Present arguments and explanations about local, regional, and global issues to reach a
target audience using print, oral, and digital technologies.

91DE5A8ECEF4426E83C6EC782C85B7D8.description: Critique arguments and explanations presented about events or issues in a world region.

44B843AD907E4AD3856D9A7AAF10C92E.description: Construct explanations using summary, sequence, examples, and data.

3F71E4ED46EA448D90BD2A97EE19EC70.description: Construct arguments using evidence from multiple sources.

A8AD3D77B8C148699F28EC80207DE229.description: Communicate Conclusions and Take Informed Action

AAE937FEFF7D4844A4FE2ABCE014E660.description: Develop claims and counterclaims in response to a compelling question.

6E4B714CC1D9430996F38C5B41C6ECD3.description: Organize and prioritize relevant evidence from multiple sources to support claims.

651A53A166254AEDB17B97A76D736055.description:
Gather relevant evidence from multiple sources using both print and digital resources and
databases (e.g., origin, authority, structure, context, credibility).

CA18E5DDFC4E4A6487D09A1B236473FC.description:
Apply disciplinary knowledge and practices to demonstrate an understanding of world
regional studies content.

6854A66DFF0241C1BCE3A3EEB32F700F.description:
Determine the kinds of sources that will be helpful in answering compelling and
supporting questions, taking into consideration multiple points of views represented in
the sources.

AB380CC2C1544FABAFB5D950B24607DB.description: Develop compelling and supporting questions that are mutually reinforcing.

87131A130080494ABB94AF2B515E473D.description:
Explain how compelling and supporting questions represent key ideas about geography
or other social science disciplines in the study of a world region.
